meanings.sent2: The surgeon lobotomised the patient to alleviate their symptoms.

meanings.sent5: The procedure to lobotomise the patient was both delicate and precise.

meanings.sent1: The lobotomised patient showed improved behavior after the surgery.

meanings.definition: To make (someone) dull or unresponsive by removing part of the brain
meanings.sent1: The movie's predictable plot lobotomised the audience's interest.
meanings.sent2: The boring lecture seemed to lobotomise the students, putting them to sleep.
meanings.sent3: His monotonous voice had a lobotomising effect on everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive tasks at work slowly lobotomised his once creative mind.
meanings.sent5: The constant noise in the city seemed to lobotomise his ability to concentrate.
